review: Chromecast works great. Installation and configuration were easy. I can wirelessly, from across the room, stream anything showing on Google Chrome. YouTube has its own app that automatically took over when I streamed a movie from YouTube.I initially loaded it on a small 11.6" laptop with an AMD A6-1450 processor & 8 GB Ram, passmark of about 1640. Performance was so-so. Some sites streamed well and some were very choppy. I prefer this small laptop over android tablets ... much better browsing and just as portable.After loading the Chromecast app on a full sized laptop with 8 GB Ram and a Sandy Bridge i3 processor, passmark of about 3300, all choppiness disappeared. Sound lipsynched perfectly and sounded great both on the TV speakers and the sound system the TV outputs to. The image on TV was crystal clear.I much prefer this over a Roku, which I once owned but returned when I found out it was not DLNA capable. My DVD player supports my DLNA needs. The Chromecast is for internet streaming only.
